description: APPLICATION FOR A VEHICULAR CROSSOVER AND ASSOCIATED HARDSTANDING INCLUDING RELOCATION OF  A STREET TREE
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site location plan, Drawings 01A & 02A and Location Plan (Replacement Tree Location)
Condition : 3 - The development hereby permitted shall not commence until the applicant has completed any necessary legal agreement with the Councils Highway and Greenspaces team that secures a short frontage agreement and planting of replacement trees respectively. 

Reason:  In the interests of the preserving tree numbers, biodiversity, safety of pedestrians and vehicles and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies CS13, CS18 and CS20 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM D2, DM O2, DM T2, T3, T4 and T5 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and London Plan 2021 policy G7.
Condition : 4 - The hardstanding hereby permitted shall be made of porous materials, or provision made to direct surface water run-off to a permeable or porous area or surface within the application site before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use.
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Advice regarding permeable and porous hardstandings can be found in the document 'Guidance on the Permeable Surfacing of Front Gardens' available at http://www.communities.gov.uk/publications/planningandbuilding/pavingfrontgardens
Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE
It is Council policy for the Council's contractor to construct new vehicular accesses. The applicant should contact the Council's Highways Team on 020 8545 3829 prior to any work starting to arrange for this work to be done. If the applicant wishes to undertake this work the Council will require a deposit and the applicant will need to cover all the Council's costs (including supervision of the works). If the works are of a significant nature, a Section 278 Agreement (Highways Act 1980) will be required and the works must be carried out to the Council's specification.
Condition : 7 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant was offered the opportunity to submit amended plans in order to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.
   ii) The application was determined within the agreed time frame
